metadata.title: CVE-2024-26950 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:wireguard: netlink: access device through ctx instead of peer The previouscommit fixed a bug that led to a NULL peer->device being dereferenced. It'sactually easier and faster performance-wise to instead get the device fromctx->wg. This semantically makes more sense too, sincectx->wg->peer_allowedips.seq is compared with ctx->allowedips_seq, basingthem both in ctx. This also acts as a defence in depth provision againstfreed peers.

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
